results.title: The Woodwinds
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Instruments of the band and orchestra”.
Explains that the woodwind instruments produce interesting and colorful sounds in bands and orchestras. Shows how woodwinds are held and played and explains the basic principle of sound production in these instruments. Includes demonstrations of the flute, fife, piccolo, clarinet, saxophone, oboe and bassoon.

group.title: Instruments of the band and orchestra

results.title: The Woodwind choir
results.brief_description: The individual tonal range and qualities of the various woodwind instruments used in a symphony orchestra, and the techniques of playing them, are demonstrated in this film. Compositions by Brahms, Mendelssohn, Rossini, von Weber, Beethoven, and Schumann are used to demonstrate the function of woodwind instruments in full orchestral setting.

results.title: The Woodlanders
results.creator_credit: Phil Agland, Barney Reisz, Pathe Productions and Channel Four
results.brief_description: Based on the novel by Thomas Hardy, “The Woodlanders” is a passionate story of love. Giles Winterborne (Rufus Sewell) and Grace Melbury (Emily Woof) have had an agreement to marry since childhood. However, Grace’s return from boarding school and subsequent elevation in society cause their engagement to be called off. Silently adored by his friend, Marty, Giles continues to pine for Grace, whilst she in turn falls in love with the handsome new doctor, Fitzpiers. But as they follow their separate courses, Grace and Giles find that their lives become inextricably entwined.

results.title: The Wooden horse
results.creator_credit: Jack Lee, Ian Dalrymple, Wessex Films and London Film Productions
results.brief_description: Based on the novel “The Wooden Horse” by Eric Williams. This is a classic wartime escape film which will not fail to enthrall. Many attempts were made to escape Nazi prison camps and a band of British officers planned a daring, ingenious escape from the notorious Stalag Luft III. Tunnelling under an exercise horse, they fought a dangerous battle to survive. Starring Leo Genn, David Tomlinson and Anthony Steel.

results.title: The Woodcutter's son
results.creator_credit: Michael Cummins, Steve Thomas and Flying Carpet Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Family foibles”.
Part of the “Family foibles” series of documentaries about five Australian families. After being sent to jail for armed robbery aged seventeen, Allan’s family disowned him. Almost thirty years later, his father is dead and Allan, now reformed and a published poet and community centre volunteer, is seeking to rebuild his relationships with his mother and sister. He travels back to country Victoria, to the town of his youth, wondering which family he really belongs to - his substitute family of crims and street people who understand him or the biological family to whom he is a stranger. His journey of reconciliation is punctuated with his poems and the train trip from Melbourne to Shepparton is interwoven with reminiscences of past events. A study guide is available from http://www.roninfilms.com.au/related/2365104851-0.pdf

results.title: The Wonderful world of Jack Paar = Jack Paar credit titles
results.brief_description: Norman McLaren was commissioned to design and shoot the main and end credit-titles for the television program The Wonderful World of Jack Paar, a special anniversary item in the long-running interview show hosted by Paar. The sound was also “animated” by McLaren. Credit: “Titles created by N. McLaren, E. Lambart”.

results.title: The Wonderful world of dogs
results.creator_credit: Mark Lewis, Channel 4, ABC-TV (Australia), Australian Film Commission and Radio Pictures
results.brief_description: 540,000 dogs inhabit the city of Sydney and every one with a story to tell. This whimsical, humorous film tells some of them, and in particular, the story of Fugly, the most impounded dog in Australia, and his impact on the suburb of Mosman. Dog lovers and dog haters alike express their point of view as we watch Fugly roaming the streets. “Some dogs just want to be dogs. Some people want dogs to be people. But dogs will be dogs … and people will be people. We all live together.”
results.creator_credit_for_label: Mark Lewis, Channel 4, ABC-TV (Australia), Australian Film Commission and Radio Pictures

results.title: The Wonderful kangaroo
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Survival Anglia Wildlife Series”.
When Captain James Cook’s expedition brought back to England the first European sketches of kangaroos, they were ridiculed as fakes. Today the kangaroo stands at the centre of another controversy. Should Australia’s national animal be under conservation or shot for the damage it can do to hard-won farmland? The childhood and family life of the cuddly Grey Kangaroo stands in sharp contrast to the demanding existence of the Great Red Kangaroo in Australia’s deserts.
